item.title: Master Book List
item.description: Psychology & Behavioral Science Thinking, Fast and Slow — Daniel Kahneman Quiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can't Stop Talking — Susan Cain Antifragile — Nassim Taleb The Coaching Habit — Michael Bungay Stanier Lost Connections — Johann Hari A Mind of Your Own — Dr. Kelly Brogan The Winner Effect — Ian H. Robertson The Expectation Effect — David Robson Good Habits, Bad Habits — Wendy Wood Science & Technology Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind — Yuval Noah Harari Other Minds — Peter Godfrey-Smith The Beautiful Cure — Daniel M.

item.title: Bookshelf
item.description: Reading The Art of Statistics: Learning from Data - David Spiegelhalter [Link] The Checklist Manifesto: How To Get Things Right - Atul Gawande [Link] Completed Poor - Katriona O’Sullivan - [Link] Bought this on a whim when I saw it as a Kindle special deal, and I’m glad I did. It covers what it means to be poor, and how some of the most vulnerable in society can fall through the cracks, how the system can let them down.
